intro: Pultenaea flexilis, commonly known as the weeping pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring slender, drooping branches. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in late winter to early spring, which are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, often with a greyish-green hue. Pultenaea flexilis is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
